comments:
I'm having trouble running Eclipse 3.1 on a PowerPC pSeries with SLES9. I
downloaded the Linux (PPC/GTK 2) eclipse-SDK-3.1-linux-gtk-ppc.tar.gz version. I
start Eclipse with -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none and I see the splash screen but
then I get a dialog box saying something like this:

An error has occurred. See the log file
/bglhome/usr3/clappi/eclipse/configuration/1126619768980.log.

The log files look like this:

!SESSION 2005-09-06 
16:18:27.491 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20050627-1435
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxp641420ifx-20040722 (142GA+75755) 
(JIT enabled: jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=ppc, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch 
ppc -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-09-06 16:18:33.201
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: 
/bglhome/usr3/clappi/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/71/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3138.so:

/bglhome/usr3/clappi/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/71/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3138.so:

cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

 at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1968)
 at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:824)
 at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:908)
 at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:123)

 at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Converter.wcsToMbcs(Converter.java:54)
 at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:122)
 at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createDisplay(Workbench.java:381)
 at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createDisplay(PlatformUI.java:155)

org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.createDisplay(IDEApplication.java:128)
 at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:79)

org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:376)

 at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

which is weird because 
/bglhome/usr3/clappi/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/71/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3138.so

is definitely there and accessible.

        libexpat.so.0 => /usr/local/lib/libexpat.so.0 (0x6f435000)

Running java -version shows this:

java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxp641420ifx-20040722
(142GA+75755) (JIT enabled: jitc))

I'm running gtk2-2.2.4-125.4 version of GTK2.

Any ideas?

Cory and I determined that the problem was that the default "java" mapped to a
64-bit VM rather than a 32-bit VM needed for Eclipse/PPC.

I am marking this as a duplicate of bug 85699, since the error message clearly
didn't help here.  Another related issue is bug 73839, which requests a 64-bit
build for ppc64 architectures.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 85699 ***

traces.message: /bglhome/usr3/clappi/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/71/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3138.so:  /bglhome/usr3/clappi/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/71/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3138.so:  cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
